Hello Adriene,

My words can not describe a gratitude I feel towards you. I started my journey a little less than a year ago. Prior to that I have never(even in the school due to health reasons) did sport or anything even remotely close to a physical activity. As an adult, I did have some attempts to get fit but i could never commit. About a year ago I started your “30 days yoga”. My journey was not perfect. I started from the beginning at least times. I understood that I’m not going to be able to do it everyday but promised myself that no matter how long it will take - I’ll finish it. It took me 6 months. But eventually I fulfilled my promise. It was a first program that I actually managed to complete in my whole life. Since I started doing this, I also explored other activities like running and dancing. Little by little I actually started loving sport and being active. It’s now really a routine. I never stopped doing yoga though. Sometimes in class, sometimes with your videos. I’m writing this because after this practice today I attempted to do a bakasana. And I did it. It was only for a few second but I still did it. I cried after this. A year ago I could not do a downward facing dog without being out of breath. And now I’m here. And it’s all thanks to the feeling that I got after your every video. It took time, but eventually I craved more and more. Thank you so much! You really changed my life.

I had even gained too much weight, and everyone kept saying, "Wow!! You have changed so much!" These words used to bother me a lot, but now through Yoga, I am able to find the balance between my body and my mind. I have even started ballet workouts alongside Yoga. Yoga helps me find balance in life, while Ballet allows me to regain my body form before this transformation. Through Yoga, I have also learned to be aware of my breaths, and this fact really helps me with ballet.
